landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges a landlord/tenant relationship: Plaintiff began renting the apartment on or about June 1, 2022, as a month‑to‑month tenant and pays $1,800/month; Defendant is alleged to be the owner/landlord (see ¶¶2‑5, 7).

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges landlord conduct/omissions: Defendant is alleged to own the building, was notified of heating problems, arranged two repair visits, but failed to cure the recurrent heating failures (see ¶¶3,9,18,21‑22).

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges repeated, recurring drops in indoor temperature to ~60°F for hours, creating uncomfortably/unreasonably cold and unsafe conditions and impairing use/enjoyment; plaintiff purchased space heaters and suffered health effects (see ¶¶8,10,11,18).

causation.reasoning: Complaint alleges causation: plaintiff notified defendant, repairs were attempted but problem recurred, and plaintiff links the unreliable heat to increased electric usage and to bronchitis (including physician indication); plaintiff alleges the harm was a direct/proximate result of defendant’s failure to provide reliable heat (see ¶¶9‑11,12,19,22).

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific damages: increased electricity costs (~$150/month), medical expenses, lost earnings (three days’ work), non‑economic loss, and an estimated compensable amount (~$650), with supporting allegations of expenditures and injury (see ¶¶10‑11,13,19,23).
